top_comment.author: Marion Taylor

captions.text:
Man, voice-over: THE YOSEMITE
GRANT WAS THE FIRST TIME
IN ALL OF HUMAN HISTORY THAT

A LARGE TRACT OF WILD LAND
WAS SET ASIDE,

NOT FOR THE EXCLUSIVE USE OF
THE RICH OR ROYALTY OF A NATION,

BUT FOR EVERYONE
AND FOR ALL TIME.

A HINGE OF HISTORY
WAS MOVING IN 1864
WHEN THEY SET YOSEMITE ASIDE.

Man, voice-over: WHEN THAT BILL
WAS PASSED AND SIGNED BY
PRESIDENT ABRAHAM LINCOLN,

WE WERE IN THE MIDST,
THE DEPTHS, THE WORST YEAR

OF THE AMERICAN CIVIL WAR,
WHERE CASUALTIES NUMBERING

2,000 A DAY WERE COMING BACK
TO WASHINGTON, DC.
ON THE SAME DAY THAT LINCOLN

SIGNED INTO LAW THE ACT
SETTING ASIDE YOSEMITE,

HE ALSO SIGNED INTO LAW
AN INCREASE IN THE INCOME TAX

TO HELP PAY FOR THE WAR THAT HE
HOPED WOULD SAVE HIS COUNTRY.

Duncan, voice-over:
FIRST OF ALL,
MOST AMERICANS BELIEVE THAT

NATIONAL PARKS HAVE
ALWAYS BEEN HERE,

THAT THEY ARE THE PRODUCT OF
SOME SORT OF AUTOMATIC PROCESS,

AND THE TRUTH IS THEY HAVEN'T
ALWAYS BEEN HERE,

AND THEY ARE ONLY THE RESULT
OF VISIONARY PEOPLE

ENGAGING IN A LONG, HARD FIGHT
TO TRY TO SAVE A PLACE
FROM DESTRUCTION.

IN THE 19th CENTURY, UP UNTIL
THE YOSEMITE GRANT,

THE BUSINESS OF CONGRESS
WAS TO DISPOSE OF PUBLIC LAND

THROUGH HOMESTEADS, FOR MINERS,
FOR LUMBERMEN,
FOR THE RAILROADS,

AND SOMETHING ABOUT THIS PLACE
MADE US STOP.

SAY, "AT LEAST HERE,
LET''’'’S DO SOMETHING DIFFERENT."

WHEN PEOPLE COMPARE IT
TO A CATHEDRAL,

THAT TELLS YOU SOMETHING,
THAT THEY SEE IT
AS A SANCTUARY, AS A REFUGE.

IT HAS THE WALLS.
IT HAS THE SACRAMENTAL WATER
THAT FLOWS INTO IT.

IT HAS ALL THOSE ELEMENTS
THAT ARE BOTH AWE-INSPIRING

AND YET SOMEHOW COMFORTING,
AT LEAST IN THE VALLEY.

AND THEN YOU GO TO
THE MARIPOSA GROVE

AND YOU'RE STANDING THERE
WITH THESE LIVING THINGS

THAT HAVE BEEN THERE
FOR THOUSANDS OF YEARS,

AND YOU HAVE TO BE A PRETTY
CALLOUS AND CALLOW PERSON

NOT TO BE IN AWE
AND IN REVERENCE
OF THESE LIVING THINGS.

AND IT'S ALL ABOUT
THIS GREAT IDEA,

AN IDEA THAT WHEN
IT WAS FIRST PROCLAIMED

WAS AS RADICAL AND UNIQUE AS
THE DECLARATION OF INDEPENDENCE,

WHICH WAS TO SAY THAT A NATION'S
MOST MAJESTIC AND SPECIAL

AND SOME WOULD SAY
SACRED PLACES

SHOULD BE A SET-ASIDE
NOT FOR THE RICH

AND FOR ROYALTY
AND THE WELL-CONNECTED,

BUT FOR EVERYONE
AND FOR ALL TIME.

AND WHEN THAT WAS FIRST APPLIED
HERE TO YOSEMITE,

THAT WAS A HISTORIC
MOMENT THAT LED

NOT ONLY TO NATIONAL PARKS
THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES

BUT LED TO NATIONAL PARKS
ACROSS THE WORLD

COPYING THE MODEL THAT HAD ITS
FIRST GERMINATION OF THE SEED
HERE IN YOSEMITE.
